ca.mcgill.ecse211.Localization

Class Full_Localization

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.Localization.Full_Localization

  • public class Full_Localization
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is in charge of performing the full localization using the Ultrasonic sensor first and then the lightsensor afterwards.
    Author:
    Alexandre

    • Method Detail

      • Corner_Localize

        public void Corner_Localize(int exp_x,
                            int exp_y)
                     throws OdometerExceptions
        Method calls methods that do the parts of the full localization in the order in which they must be performed. The method first does the ultrasonic localization, followed by a light localization on the tile on which it is on and goes to the front right coordinate point of the grid lines
        Parameters:
        exp_x - expected x coordinate at the end of localization
        exp_y - expected y coordinate at the end of localization
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • Tile_Localize

        public void Tile_Localize(int exp_x,
                          int exp_y)
                   throws OdometerExceptions
        Method to make the robot localize to go on the corner of a tile. The robot move forward until it arrives to a black line where it corrects the odometer to the corresponding distance on the field from the origin for one coordinate parameter (x or y). It will repeat with the other parameter. The robot will backup with the light sensor correcting its heading and finish on the coordinate point with the offset of the light sensors.
        Parameters:
        exp_x - expected x coordinate at the end of localization
        exp_y - expected y coordinate at the end of localization
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • parameter_correction

        public void parameter_correction(int exp_x,
                                 int exp_y)
        Method to the odometer value for x or y. corrects the odometer by taking the coordinate distance from the origin added or subtracted depending on the heading
        Parameters:
        exp_x - expected x coordinate at the end of localization
        exp_y - expected y coordinate at the end of localization
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions
